group_1.narration: After that day, I had no interaction@with Tsukasa for quite some time...

group_1.textLeft: I see you're still coming to school...

group_1.textRight: The craft club's leader is out of the@hospital, so today was my last day.

group_1.textLeft: I must apologize, we were only able to place@second in the school cultural festival...

group_1.textRight: That's fine and all, but what's more@important now is you.
You seemed happier for a while, so I@thought you'd be okay, but...
That serious look is back in your eyes.

group_1.textLeft: Please don't concern yourself over me.

group_1.textRight: Ah... Did I cross a line?

group_1.textLeft: It's a comfort knowing that you care...
I shall be going home now...

group_1.textCenter: (I'm in no mood for training. I shall play my@flute before returning home.)
For if I do not...I don't think I can cope@any longer...
(But, Tsukasa might be at that shrine...)

group_1.narration: Tranquility never came to my heart no matter@how much I played my flute that day.
It was not, however, because@I did not play at the shrine.

group_1.textCenter: I yearn to speak with Tsukasa...

group_1.narration: My heart longed for the only person@I ever found who understood me.
But the only time we were ever at@ease was when airing our grievances.
Once attention shifted back to what@we could not stand about each other,@the inferno would ignite once again.
That's why I never attempted to@make contact with Tsukasa after that.
However, for better or worse, a message@from my grandmother became the@final straw that led me to make my wish...

group_1.textCenter: Oh? A message... Could it be from Tsukasa?!

group_1.narration: "Why are you absent without permission?@It seems that I was foolish for believing@you would not tarnish our name."
"I have asked your instructor to double@your training to make up for lost time."@
"I shall escort you for the foreseeable@future. Do not go anywhere on your own."

group_1.textCenter: This is ridiculous! What makes the Akatsuki@family so great?!
Not a doll for Grandmother to order about!
Nor a sacrificial lamb for the Akatsukis!

group_1.narration: What happened after that is unknown to me.
I was just so furious, tears rolling down@my cheeks, that I became dizzy,@the world blurring around me.
The last thing I heard was "Tsukuyo!"@It was Mifuyu calling out to me...@
